I retired too early....

After running successful businesses for many years, I decided it was time to stop working and travel the world. I had enough of that. Now my brain is mad at me for not giving it any challenges. So, I am offering up my years of experience to better the quality of life for small business owners. Unlike other consultants or consulting firms who may be desperate for their next dollar, I just want a challenge to keep my mind working. With me, you will not have to worry about someone trying to make a quick buck on you. That doesn’t mean I work for free. We will come to a fair and agreeable transaction that will benefit both of us. If that means extended terms, or equity swaps, so be it.

I Can Help - I have 25+ years in Operational, Technical, and Financial Executive Management.

Automate: When repetitive processes are automated, you can instead devote time to the goals that really matter—like growing the business or spending time doing the things you enjoy. Automation can benefit six areas of your business: leads, sales, e-commerce, customer service and engagement, events, and office management. Automation will save money, time, and, of course, will help relieve some stress.

Organize: When you organize your business and eliminate the clutter, you will feel reenergized. You will find that you are easily motivated to get straight to work when you don't have a mess to deal with. You will save time, money and, of course feel less stressed.

Streamline: When it comes to small business operations, efficiency and effectiveness are key. Fortunately, with the help of a few different tools and methods, you can streamline your business – and free up time to focus on just doing your job.

Extrapolate: The statistical technique of inferring unknown from the known is called extrapolation. It attempts to predict future data by relying on historical data. When the current trends are recognized you can save money, time and, of course, have less stress.

Prepare: It took an incredible amount of time, money and resources to open your business. You put together your business plan, found the perfect team to support you in your venture and have established a solid foundation to get it up and running. But in the event that major setbacks occur, do you have a plan? Are you prepared? Do You have a Plan A, Plan B, Plan C and Plan D?

Anticipate: Anticipating the moves of your competitors, along with anticipating the needs of your customers is an everyday task which can’t be overlooked. Although it’s great to have 20-20 hindsight, it all comes down to what to anticipate to keep your stress level down.

Modernize: The world has changed. Digital has changed it. Customers have different expectations from 10 years ago. Your business needs to adapt if you want to survive. You need to modernize to meet the needs of today’s connected customers. To leverage digital technologies to their advantage.

Report: The day-to-day running of any business is time consuming. It leaves owners with little free time to step back and see the bigger picture. This is a problem. When you're focused on the daily issues, it's hard to get a good feel for where your business is going. As a result: Small problems can escalate if they aren't caught quickly. Opportunities are missed if there's no time to look at them. Changing market conditions can catch you unawares if you aren't prepared. Having the best reports will set you free. You will save time, money, and of course, fell less stressed.

Money

  • 25 plus years’ experience of running the books
  • Full responsibility of the P & L’s
  • Planning and keeping to budgets
  • Long range forecasting
  • Statistical analysis of all financial data
  • Bank float
  • Keeping a high ROI for myself and investors.
  • Used every type of QuickBooks from the online version to the multi user Enterprise version. With advanced skills of importing into Quick Books I can automate most processes.
  • Accounting packages (QuickBooks, Sage, and Cloud Based solutions and fully understand integration with other systems
  • Successfully gone through 2 State (DOR) and 1 Federal (IRS) audits. All three audits came back with a “no-change.”

Employees

  • In managing people, I not only led by example, but also had the full respect of all employees because of my knowledge, communication skills, and the respect I gave them.
  • By the time I was in college I was in charge of over 150 employees which ran across 5 different departments
  • Running my first telecommunications company, I had to hire, train and motivate over 75 employees.
  • I also had worldwide offices in which I needed to manage across languages and time zones.

Technology

  • Strong technical / engineering background in a wide range of computer systems (Windows, OSX, and Linux), and networking
  • Databases (SQL, MySQL, Access, Amazon Aurora, RDS, PostgreSQL, Redshift, and DynamoDB, Athena, Quicksight, Data Pipeline)
  • Amazon Web Services (AWS) (EC2, ELB, VPC, Cognito, S3, Auto-Scaling, Lambda, Kinesis, IoT, EBS, CloudFront, Route 53, Elasticache, API Gateway, Glacier, LightSail, etc.).
  • Expert skills in Microsoft programs (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access, SharePoint, Project, Visio and Outlook)
  • Extensive knowledge with Microsoft cloud products including Office 365.
  • Certified in AWS and extensive knowledge of its counterparts at Google Cloud and Microsoft Azure.
  • A lifetime of using programming languages including but not limited to JavaScript, Java, Python, PHP, Ruby, Swift, C#, BASIC, HTML, Pascal and others.
  • Skilled in extrapolating data to reflect current trends, upturns, unrecognized profit centers, and problems that normal reporting systems / personnel would overlook.
  • Well versed in digital marketing environment.
  • Extensive experience with Google Analytics / Ad words, Facebook and Twitter ads, along with remarketing campaigns.
  • Experienced in e-commerce and SEO.
  • Substantial experience with website design and best practices.

Customers

  • Recurring Revenue - I had 700K + subscribers who paid monthly / annually with a churn rate of less than 8% (Translation: Happy customers)

  • B2B - Directed staff and the daily operations of a route division with over 500 stores distributing products. Every store owner was a happy customer.
  • Great Customer Service Builds Loyalty
  • Prided myself in the launching of an efficient, comprehensive, knowledgeable, and award-winning customer service.
  • Whether an in-office center or out of the country call-center, the seat count was kept at an optimal rate to keep customers happy at the lowest cost.
